events.name: SW_INCR
events.description: Software increment. Instruction architecturally executed (condition code check pass)

events.name: L1I_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: L1 instruction cache refill. This event counts any instruction fetch which misses in the cache. The following instructions are not counted: " Cache maintenance instructions. " Non-cacheable accesses

events.name: L1I_TLB_REFILL
events.description: L1 instruction TLB refill. This event counts any refill of the instruction L1 TLB from the L2 TLB. This includes refills that result in a translation fault. The following instructions are not counted: " TLB maintenance instructions. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled

events.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: L1 data cache refill. This event counts any load or store operation or page table walk access which causes data to be read from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1. The following instructions are not counted: " Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches. " Stores of an entire cache line, even if they make a coherency request outside the L1. " Partial cache line writes which do not allocate into the L1 cache. " Non-cacheable accesses. This event counts the sum of L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD and L1D_CACHE_REFILL_WR

events.name: L1D_CACHE
events.description: L1 data cache access. This event counts any load or store operation or page table walk access which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the L1D_CACHE_REFILL event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted: " Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches. " Non-cacheable accesses. This event counts the sum of L1D_CACHE_RD and L1D_CACHE_WR

events.name: L1D_TLB_REFILL
events.description: L1 data TLB refill. This event counts any refill of the data L1 TLB from the L2 TLB. This includes refills that result in a translation fault. The following instructions are not counted: " TLB maintenance instructions. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled

events.name: INST_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed. This event counts all retired instructions, including those that fail their condition check

events.name: EXC_TAKEN
events.description: Exception taken

events.name: EXC_RETURN
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, exception return

events.name: CID_WRITE_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, write to CONTEXTIDR. This event only counts writes to CONTEXTIDR in AArch32 state, and via the CONTEXTIDR_EL1 mnemonic in AArch64 state. The following instructions are not counted: " Writes to CONTEXTIDR_EL12 and CONTEXTIDR_EL2

events.name: BR_MIS_PRED
events.description: Mispredicted or not predicted branch speculatively executed. This event counts any predictable branch instruction which is mispredicted either due to dynamic misprediction or because the MMU is off and the branches are statically predicted not taken

events.name: CPU_CYCLES
events.description: Cycle

events.name: BR_PRED
events.description: Predictable branch speculatively executed. This event counts all predictable branches

events.name: MEM_ACCESS
events.description: Data memory access. This event counts memory accesses due to load or store instructions. The following instructions are not counted: " Instruction fetches. " Cache maintenance instructions. " Translation table walks or prefetches. This event counts the sum of MEM_ACCESS_RD and MEM_ACCESS_WR

events.name: L1I_CACHE
events.description: Level 1 instruction cache access or Level 0 Macro-op cache access. This event counts any instruction fetch which accesses the L1 instruction cache or L0 Macro-op cache. The following instructions are not counted: " Cache maintenance instructions. " Non-cacheable accesses

events.name: L1D_CACHE_WB
events.description: L1 data cache Write-Back. This event counts any write-back of data from the L1 data cache to L2 or L3. This counts both victim line evictions and snoops, including cache maintenance operations. The following instructions are not counted: " Invalidations which do not result in data being transferred out of the L1. " Full-line writes which write to L2 without writing L1, such as write streaming mode

events.name: L2D_CACHE
events.description: L2 data cache access. This event counts any transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache, and any write-back from the L1 to the L2. Snoops from outside the core and cache maintenance operations are not counted

events.name: L2D_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: L2 data cache refill. This event counts any cacheable transaction from L1 which causes data to be read from outside the core. L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 should not be counted

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WB
events.description: L2 data cache write-back. This event counts any write-back of data from the L2 cache to outside the core. This includes snoops to the L2 which return data, regardless of whether they cause an invalidation. Invalidations from the L2 which do not write data outside of the core and snoops which return data from the L1 are not counted

events.name: BUS_ACCESS
events.description: Bus access. This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the data channels between the core and the SCU. If both read and write data beats are transferred on a given cycle, this event is counted twice on that cycle. This event counts the sum of BUS_ACCESS_RD and BUS_ACCESS_WR

events.name: MEMORY_ERROR
events.description: Local memory error. This event counts any correctable or uncorrectable memory error (ECC or parity) in the protected core RAMs

events.name: INST_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed

events.name: TTBR_WRITE_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, write to TTBR.This event only counts writes to TTBR0/TTBR1 in AArch32 state and TTBR0_EL1/TTBR1_EL1 in AArch64 state. The following instructions are not counted: " Accesses to TTBR0_EL12/TTBR1_EL12 or TTBR0_EL2/ TTBR1_EL2

events.name: BUS_CYCLES
events.description: Bus cycles. This event duplicates CPU_CYCLES

events.name: CHAIN
events.description: For odd-numbered counters, increments the count by one for each overflow of the preceding even-numbered counter. For even-numbered counters, there is no increment

events.name: L2D_CACHE_ALLOCATE
events.description: L2 data cache allocation without refill. This event counts any full cache line write into the L2 cache which does not cause a linefill, including write-backs from L1 to L2 and full-line writes which do not allocate into L1

events.name: BR_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, branch. This event counts all branches, taken or not. This excludes exception entries, debug entries and CCFAIL branches

events.name: BR_MIS_PRED_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, mispredicted branch. This event counts any branch counted by BR_RETIRED which is not correctly predicted and causes a pipeline flush

events.name: STALL_FRONTEND
events.description: No operation issued because of the frontend. The counter counts on any cycle when there are no fetched instructions available to dispatch

events.name: STALL_BACKEND
events.description: No operation issued because of the backend. The counter counts on any cycle fetched instructions are not dispatched due to resource constraints

events.name: L1D_TLB
events.description: Level 1 data TLB access. This event counts any load or store operation which accesses the data L1 TLB. If both a load and a store are executed on a cycle, this event counts twice. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled

events.name: L1I_TLB
events.description: Level 1 instruction TLB access. This event counts any instruction fetch which accesses the instruction L1 TLB.This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled

events.name: L3D_CACHE_ALLOCATE
events.description: Attributable L3 data or unified cache allocation without refill. This event counts any full cache line write into the L3 cache which does not cause a linefill, including write-backs from L2 to L3 and full-line writes which do not allocate into L2

events.name: L3D_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: Attributable Level 3 unified cache refill. This event counts for any cacheable read transaction returning data from the SCU for which the data source was outside the cluster. Transactions such as ReadUnique are counted here as 'read' transactions, even though they can be generated by store instructions

events.name: L3D_CACHE
events.description: Attributable Level 3 unified cache access. This event counts for any cacheable read transaction returning data from the SCU, or for any cacheable write to the SCU

events.name: L2D_TLB_REFILL
events.description: Attributable L2 data or unified TLB refill. This event counts on any refill of the L2 TLB, caused by either an instruction or data access. This event does not count if the MMU is disabled

events.name: L2D_TLB
events.description: Attributable L2 data or unified TLB access. This event counts on any access to the L2 TLB (caused by a refill of any of the L1 TLBs). This event does not count if the MMU is disabled

events.name: REMOTE_ACCESS
events.description: Access to another socket in a multi-socket system

events.name: DTLB_WALK
events.description: Access to data TLB that caused a page table walk. This event counts on any data access which causes L2D_TLB_REFILL to count

events.name: ITLB_WALK
events.description: Access to instruction TLB that caused a page table walk. This event counts on any instruction access which causes L2D_TLB_REFILL to count

events.name: LL_CACHE_RD
events.description: Last level cache access, read. " If CPUECTLR.EXTLLC is set: This event counts any cacheable read transaction which returns a data source of 'interconnect cache'. " If CPUECTLR.EXTLLC is not set: This event is a duplicate of the L*D_CACHE_RD event corresponding to the last level of cache implemented - L3D_CACHE_RD if both per-core L2 and cluster L3 are implemented, L2D_CACHE_RD if only one is implemented, or L1D_CACHE_RD if neither is implemented

events.name: LL_CACHE_MISS_RD
events.description: Last level cache miss, read. " If CPUECTLR.EXTLLC is set: This event counts any cacheable read transaction which returns a data source of 'DRAM', 'remote' or 'inter-cluster peer'. " If CPUECTLR.EXTLLC is not set: This event is a duplicate of the L*D_CACHE_REFILL_RD event corresponding to the last level of cache implemented - L3D_CACHE_REFILL_RD if both percore L2 and cluster L3 are implemented, L2D_CACHE_REFILL_RD if only one is implemented, or L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD if neither is implemented

events.name: L1D_CACHE_RD
events.description: L1 data cache access, read. This event counts any load operation or page table walk access which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted: " Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches. " Non-cacheable accesses

events.name: L1D_CACHE_WR
events.description: L1 data cache access, write. This event counts any store operation which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the L1D_CACHE_REFILL_WR event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted: " Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches. " Non-cacheable accesses

events.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD
events.description: L1 data cache refill, read. This event counts any load operation or page table walk access which causes data to be read from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1. The following instructions are not counted: " Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches. " Non-cacheable accesses

events.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL_WR
events.description: L1 data cache refill, write. This event counts any store operation which causes data to be read from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1. The following instructions are not counted: " Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches. " Stores of an entire cache line, even if they make a coherency request outside the L1. " Partial cache line writes which do not allocate into the L1 cache. " Non-cacheable accesses

events.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL_INNER
events.description: L1 data cache refill, inner. This event counts any L1 D-cache linefill (as counted by L1D_CACHE_REFILL) which hits in the L2 cache, L3 cache or another core in the cluster

events.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL_OUTER
events.description: L1 data cache refill, outer. This event counts any L1 D-cache linefill (as counted by L1D_CACHE_REFILL) which does not hit in the L2 cache, L3 cache or another core in the cluster, and instead obtains data from outside the cluster

events.name: L1D_CACHE_WB_VICTIM
events.description: L1 data cache write-back, victim

events.name: L1D_CACHE_WB_CLEAN
events.description: L1 data cache write-back cleaning and coherency

events.name: L1D_CACHE_INVAL
events.description: L1 data cache invalidate

events.name: L1D_TLB_REFILL_RD
events.description: L1 data TLB refill, read

events.name: L1D_TLB_REFILL_WR
events.description: L1 data TLB refill, write

events.name: L1D_TLB_RD
events.description: L1 data TLB access, read

events.name: L1D_TLB_WR
events.description: L1 data TLB access, write

events.name: L2D_CACHE_RD
events.description: L2 data cache access, read. This event counts any read transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache. Snoops from outside the core are not counted

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WR
events.description: L2 data cache access, write. This event counts any write transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache or any write-back from L1 which allocates into the L2 cache. Snoops from outside the core are not counted

events.name: L2D_CACHE_REFILL_RD
events.description: L2 data cache refill, read. This event counts any cacheable read transaction from L1 which causes data to be read from outside the core. L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 should not be counted. Transactions such as ReadUnique are counted here as 'read' transactions, even though they can be generated by store instructions

events.name: L2D_CACHE_REFILL_WR
events.description: L2 data cache refill, write. This event counts any write transaction from L1 which causes data to be read from outside the core. L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 should not be counted. Transactions such as ReadUnique are not counted as write transactions

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WB_VICTIM
events.description: L2 data cache write-back, victim

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WB_CLEAN
events.description: L2 data cache write-back, cleaning and coherency

events.name: L2D_CACHE_INVAL
events.description: L2 data cache invalidate

events.name: L2D_TLB_REFILL_RD
events.description: L2 data or unified TLB refill, read

events.name: L2D_TLB_REFILL_WR
events.description: L2 data or unified TLB refill, write

events.name: L2D_TLB_RD
events.description: L2 data or unified TLB access, read

events.name: L2D_TLB_WR
events.description: L2 data or unified TLB access, write

events.name: BUS_ACCESS_RD
events.description: Bus access read. This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the read data channel between the core and the SCU

events.name: BUS_ACCESS_WR
events.description: Bus access write. This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the write data channel between the core and the SCU

events.name: MEM_ACCESS_RD
events.description: Data memory access, read. This event counts memory accesses due to load instructions. The following instructions are not counted: " Instruction fetches. " Cache maintenance instructions. " Translation table walks. " Prefetches

events.name: MEM_ACCESS_WR
events.description: Data memory access, write. This event counts memory accesses due to store instructions. The following instructions are not counted: " Instruction fetches. " Cache maintenance instructions. " Translation table walks. " Prefetches

events.name: UNALIGNED_LD_SPEC
events.description: Unaligned access, read

events.name: UNALIGNED_ST_SPEC
events.description: Unaligned access, write

events.name: UNALIGNED_LDST_SPEC
events.description: Unaligned access

events.name: LDREX_SPEC
events.description: Exclusive operation speculatively executed, LDREX or LDX

events.name: STREX_PASS_SPEC
events.description: Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX or STX pass

events.name: STREX_FAIL_SPEC
events.description: Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX or STX fail

events.name: STREX_SPEC
events.description: Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX or STX

events.name: LD_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, load

events.name: ST_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, store

events.name: LDST_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, load or store. This event counts the sum of LD_SPEC and ST_SPEC

events.name: DP_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, integer data-processing

events.name: ASE_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, Advanced SIMD instruction

events.name: VFP_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, floating-point instruction

events.name: PC_WRITE_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, software change of the PC

events.name: CRYPTO_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, Cryptographic instruction

events.name: BR_IMMED_SPEC
events.description: Branch speculatively executed, immediate branch

events.name: BR_RETURN_SPEC
events.description: Branch speculatively executed, procedure return

events.name: BR_INDIRECT_SPEC
events.description: Branch speculatively executed, indirect branch

events.name: ISB_SPEC
events.description: Barrier speculatively executed, ISB

events.name: DSB_SPEC
events.description: Barrier speculatively executed, DSB

events.name: DMB_SPEC
events.description: Barrier speculatively executed, DMB

events.name: EXC_UNDEF
events.description: Counts the number of undefined exceptions taken locally

events.name: EXC_SVC
events.description: Exception taken locally, Supervisor Call

events.name: EXC_PABORT
events.description: Exception taken locally, Instruction Abort

events.name: EXC_DABORT
events.description: Exception taken locally, Data Abort and SError

events.name: EXC_IRQ
events.description: Exception taken locally, IRQ

events.name: EXC_FIQ
events.description: Exception taken locally, FIQ

events.name: EXC_SMC
events.description: Exception taken locally, Secure Monitor Call

events.name: EXC_HVC
events.description: Exception taken locally, Hypervisor Call

events.name: EXC_TRAP_PABORT
events.description: Exception taken, Instruction Abort not taken locally

events.name: EXC_TRAP_DABORT
events.description: Exception taken, Data Abort or SError not taken locally

events.name: EXC_TRAP_OTHER
events.description: Exception taken, Other traps not taken locally

events.name: EXC_TRAP_IRQ
events.description: Exception taken, IRQ not taken locally

events.name: EXC_TRAP_FIQ
events.description: Exception taken, FIQ not taken locally

events.name: RC_LD_SPEC
events.description: Release consistency operation speculatively executed, load-acquire

events.name: RC_ST_SPEC
events.description: Release consistency operation speculatively executed, store-release

events.name: L3_CACHE_RD
events.description: L3 cache read
